Lena is a character that's hard to pin down. She was one of my favorite "main" characters in the last few seasons of the CW show Friends. She's kind, understanding, caring, and supportive, but she's also a little naive and easily swayed by her friends (which is why she's actually so easy on camera).

My husband was actually so excited to see her pop up after the final episode and was quite relieved to find out that she was the same Lola that we grew up with.

Lena has had some emotional struggles since her husband left for work, and her relationship with her children and mother have also been affected by her emotions. She's very self-aware, and while she didn't make much of a mark on the show (she was almost exclusively an actor to all the other characters and was an average-level producer, so that means no scenes at the dinner table or cooking), her role as a single mother and grieving individual was very relevant to the current world of the show and has allowed it to show a side of the show that wasn't always evident.
